name: Featured Image on Top
author: Decarbonated Web Services

sections.description:
It may be my personal preference, but I really like having the “Featured Image” metabox up at the top of my screen. I use it almost first thing on every post I write, so I don’t like searching for it. This plugin will force that metabox on top for the “post” post type.
There’s only one option available, in the regular Media Settings page. “Allow Users to Customize Order” which is ON by default, can force users (if off) to have their “Featured Image” metabox stuck to the top.

Feel free to contact me, emrikol@gmail.com, if you have any problems or questions.
sections.installation: Extract the zip file and just drop the contents in the wp-content/plugins/ directory of your WordPress installation and then activate the Plugin from Plugins page.

short_description: Tired of having to move your "Featured Images" metabox to the top?  I've got a fix for that!
description:
It may be my personal preference, but I really like having the “Featured Image” metabox up at the top of my screen. I use it almost first thing on every post I write, so I don’t like searching for it. This plugin will force that metabox on top for the “post” post type.
There’s only one option available, in the regular Media Settings page. “Allow Users to Customize Order” which is ON by default, can force users (if off) to have their “Featured Image” metabox stuck to the top.

Feel free to contact me, emrikol@gmail.com, if you have any problems or questions.

screenshots.caption: The post screen showing the metabox up in the top right. Not really that fancy.
The only option in the plugin. It can force all users to keep the metabox up to, despite how they order their metaboxes.
